TEST.0.title: North Carolina Division C State Test

CIPHER.0.cipherString: And to all this she must yet add something more substantial, in the improvement of her mind by extensive reading.
CIPHER.0.question: Decode this quote by Jane Austen which has been encoded as an Aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: Listen to me, dear. When life hands you something, you take it, for in all likelihood, there’s a large crisis heading your way.
CIPHER.1.question: In The Weaver of Odds, Louise Blackwick wrote the following quote which has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  Please decode it so we know what was said.

CIPHER.2.keyword: JOHANNES DEI GRACIA REX ANGLIE, DOMINUS HIBERNIE, DUX NORMANNIE, AQUITANNIE ET COMES ANDEGAVIE, ARCHIEPISCOPIS, EPISCOPIS, ABBATIBUS, COMITIBUS, BARONIBUS, JUSTICIARIIS, FORESTARIIS, VICECOMITIBUS, PREPOSITIS, MINISTRIS ET OMNIBUS BALLIVIS ET FIDELIBUS SUIS SALUTEM.
CIPHER.2.cipherString: Science is not about making predictions or performing experiments. Science is about explaining.
CIPHER.2.question: Bill Gaede has something important to tell you, but it has been encoded using the Running Key Cipher against a famous document.  What does it say?

CIPHER.3.question: Using a key of POET compute the decryption matrix for a 2x2 Hill with a 26 character alphabet.

CIPHER.4.cipherString: Ever since happiness heard your name, it has been running through the streets trying to find you.
CIPHER.4.question: A quote attributed to the Persian poet Hafez has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  What was he trying to say?

CIPHER.5.cipherString: Beware of little expenses; a small leak will sink a great ship.
CIPHER.5.question: Decode this quote by Benjamin Franklin which has been encoded using Vigenère cipher using a keyword of "TEMPO"

CIPHER.23.question:
Tyson, has faithfully followed the steps of the RSA key-generation algorithm. Here are the results:

   p = 163
   q = 521
   n = 84923
   Φ = 84240
   e = 27317

Unfortunately, Tyson doesn't know how to compute the value of d and needs you to do that final step for them.

CIPHER.7.cipherString: Leonardo Da Vinci combined art and science and aesthetics and engineering, that kind of unity is needed once again.
CIPHER.7.question: An observation by Ben Shneiderman has been encoded using the Caesar Cipher.  What did they say?

CIPHER.8.cipherString: Life is more fun if you play games.
CIPHER.8.question: Encode this phrase by Roald Dahl using the affine cipher with a=15 and b=8

CIPHER.9.cipherString: He llevado el pensamiento científico a la literatura.Ha habido muy poca gratitud por esto.
CIPHER.9.question: Solve this Spanish translation of a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr. which has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.9.translation: I’ve brought scientific thinking to literature. There’s been very little gratitude for this.

CIPHER.10.cipherString: A scnetiist can discover a knew star, but he cannot make won. He wood halve tow ask in engineer two dew taht.
CIPHER.10.question: Your friend dropped their cell phone and cracked it.  With a cracked display they badly mangled generating an aristocrat for you using a K2 keyword.  What did they manage to enter using their broken phone?

CIPHER.11.cipherString: If I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
CIPHER.11.question: A phrase by Mahatma Gandhi has been encoded with the Atbash cipher.  What does it say?

CIPHER.12.cipherString: Live authentically. Why would you continue to compromise something that's beautiful to create something that is fake?
CIPHER.12.question: Some sage advice by Steve Maraboli has been encoded using a K2 alphabet.  It starts out as "LIVEA".  What does the entire quote say?

CIPHER.13.cipherString: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree, a specially knot when theirs a snake curled up inn it slims.
CIPHER.13.question: Alexa was listening to Jughead on Riverdale and mangled this quote which has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did it come out as?

CIPHER.14.cipherString: There is no science in creativity. If you don't give yourself room to fail, you won't innovate.
CIPHER.14.question: Decrypt this quote by Bob Iger which has been encoded using a Vigenère cipher using a common 6 letter word.   We know that the 16th through 22nd letters (IVGHCYE) decode to be EINCREA.

CIPHER.15.cipherString: I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!
CIPHER.15.question: Mark Twain has something to tell us about himself, but along the way someone decided that it should be encoded as a Baconian cipher.  What did he say?

CIPHER.16.question: Hannah and Haylee are accountants for a very large bank, and have started a friendship. They communicate via email, because they live thousands of miles apart. Haylee gets curious and asks Hannah the year that they were born. Hannah doesn’t mind telling Haylee, but they know that the bank monitors all employee emails, and is afraid of being the victim of age discrimination. Therefore, Haylee suggests that they use RSA, and provides their public key: (101069, 65729). Hannah replies with the ciphertext 61398. Haylee’s private key is 79169. In what year was Hannah born?

CIPHER.17.cipherString: Such is the respect for physicians that most people are astonished when one of them falls sick—and yet they do.
CIPHER.17.question: Solve this aristocrat which is a quote by Isaac Asimov containing the word THAT.

CIPHER.18.question: Encode this phrase by Lisa Nichols using the Hill Cipher with a key of MELLOWING

CIPHER.19.cipherString: Don't try to fix me, I'm not broken...
CIPHER.19.question: Decode this phrase from a song by Evanescence encoded using the Affine Cipher in which the next to the last two letters "CO" actually decode to be "KE".

CIPHER.20.cipherString: I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it.
CIPHER.20.question: Charles Schultz was famous for providing advice through his characters in his comics.  In one comic strip, Sally told Charlie Brown what she had learned.  The following strange headlines reproduce what she said.  It starts out as "ITHIN".  What did she say?

CIPHER.21.question:
Nicholas and Austin want to communicate with each other using RSA for encryption. Nicholas generates RSA keys obtaining the following values:

   e = 123643      n = 316171
   Φ = 315000      p = 751
   q = 421      d = 286507

Likewise, Austin also generates RSA keys resulting in the values

   Φ = 579264      p = 863
   q = 673      e = 283361
   d = 415073      n = 580799

They ask each other for the public keys in order to communicate. What information do they each need to transmit in response?

You must also determine what formula (using the number values) that Nicholas needs to calculate in order to transmit the value 47581 to Austin

CIPHER.22.cipherString: One of the advantages of science is that one's work, ultimately, is either replicated or it is not.
CIPHER.22.question:
A quote by Kay Redfield Jamison has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  The word IS appears three times in the quote.  What does it decode to?

Solve this aristocrat with a hint

CIPHER.6.cipherString: América es un país de inventores, y los más grandes inventores son los hombres del periódico.
CIPHER.6.question: A humorous observation by Alexander Graham Bell has been translated to Spanish and encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet with an English keyword.  What does it decode to?
CIPHER.6.translation: America is a country of inventors, and the greatest of inventors are the newspaper men.

CIPHER.24.cipherString: I am the captain of my soul.
CIPHER.24.question: Decode this quote by Nelson Mandela which has been encoded using a Hill Cipher with a keyword of HINT.  Remember that you will have to first compute the decryption matrix in order to decode the phrase.
